ferc_filing_data.tariff_title: PNM Cost Based Tariff Vol No. 7

record_data.record_title: PNM Cost Based Tariff Vol No. 7
record_data.record_narrative_name: Baseline of Cost Based Tariff FERC Electric Tariff Vol. No. 7
record_data.record_plain_text: PUBLIC SERVICE COMPANY OF NEW MEXICO COST-BASED POWER AND ENERGY SALES TARIFF 1. Availability: Public Service Company of New Mexico (PNM) makes wholesale energy and capacity available under this Tariff at rates not to exceed cost-based levels, as set forth herein. This Tariff is not subject to, nor affected by, any limitations on PNMs market-based rate authority. The determination of whether to enter into agreements under this Tariff shall be made at PNMs sole discretion. 2. Duration of Service: This Tariff authorizes sales of capacity or energy for any period of time less than one year in duration. Sales of one year or longer duration shall be filed with the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission. 3. Character of Service: PNM may provide capacity and/or energy under this Tariff in varying amounts, at varying levels of firmness or priorities of service. Service will be provided at 60 Hertz, alternating current, three phase and at mutually agreed to voltage levels. 4. Rates: All sales shall be made at rates established by agreement between the purchaser and PNM; provided, however, that the rate charged by PNM shall not exceed 110 percent of the incremental cost (IC) of the incremental resource (Incremental Resource) dispatched by PNM during the period of such sale, as defined herein. a. PNM Unit In the event PNMs Incremental Resource is a generating unit owned by PNM (an Incremental Unit), IC = [V x (F + VOM)] + SU, Where, V = the total MWh sold, F = PNMs incremental fuel cost (in $/MWh), which is further defined as equal to HR x FC Where, HR = the heat rate (in MMBtu/MWh) of the Incremental Unit at the MW level to which the unit was dispatched, FC = PNMs average delivered fuel cost (in $/MMBtu) for fuel consumed at the Incremental Unit (reflecting all costs incurred by PNM associated with such fuel supply), and The Incremental Unit is the unit dispatched during the period of the sale with the highest incremental fuel costs (as defined by the above formula), VOM = the actual variable operations and maintenance costs incurred, such costs not to exceed $3.57/MWh times the ratio of the U.S. Governments nationwide Producer Price Index (PPI) during the month of the sale to the June 2006 PPI, SU = the actual start-up costs of any unit(s) brought on-line in order to make the sale (in $), which is further defined as SUF x SUFC + SUOM, Where, SUF = the quantity of fuel (in MMBtu) consumed to start up such unit(s), SUFC = PNMs average delivered fuel cost (in $/MMBtu) for fuel consumed during such start-up, and SUOM = any operations and maintenance costs directly resulting from the start-up (in $) (such cost not to include variable operations and maintenance costs incurred for running the unit(s) following start-up). b. PNM Purchase In the event the Incremental Resource is a purchase of energy by PNM, IC equals the cost to PNM (in $/MWh) of such purchase multiplied by the total MWh of the sale. 5. Transmission Service: Unless otherwise agreed, it shall be the responsibility of the purchaser to make any necessary arrangements for delivery of electric energy for sales under this Tariff. 6. Service Agreements: PNM and the purchaser shall execute a Service Agreement that includes, without limitation, all necessary service specifications. PNM reserves the right to enter into transactions under this Tariff by filing an unexecuted Service Agreement. PNM may refuse, at its sole discretion, to enter into an individual Service Agreement under this Tariff. PNM is under no obligation to execute a Service Agreement to provide service hereunder. 7. Revisions to Tariff: PNM may file revisions to this Tariff with the FERC. Nothing contained in this Tariff shall be construed as affecting or limiting in any way the right of PNM to file unilaterally with the FERC for a change in any aspect of this Tariff under Section 205 or 206 of the Federal Power Act pursuant to the FERCs Rules and Regulations promulgated thereunder.
record_data.filing_title: PNM Cost Based Tariff Vol No. 7
